initial.title: Step 0: Initial State
initial.description:
SJF (Shortest Job First) is a NON-PREEMPTIVE scheduling algorithm.

Core Rules:
- Select the process with the SHORTEST burst time from ready queue
- Once a process starts, it runs to completion
- Tie-breakers: Burst time → Arrival time → Process ID

Our problem set has {num_processes} processes: {process_list}.

show_arrivals.title: Step 1: Mark Arrival Times (RS)
show_arrivals.description:
Mark when each process arrives and enters the ready queue.

Arrival order: {arrival_order}

RS (Ready State) markers show when each process becomes available for scheduling.
Unlike FCFS, arrival order does NOT determine execution order!

first_block.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} begins (Burst={burst})

continue_block.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} continues (t={current_time})
continue_block.description:
Process {process_id} (Burst={burst}) continues execution.

SJF is non-preemptive, so {process_id} runs uninterrupted.
This is block {block_num} of {burst}.
Blocks remaining: {remaining}

process_complete.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} completes!

select_next.title: Step {step}: Selecting next process
select_next.description:
CPU is free. Checking ready queue at t={current_time}...

Ready processes (sorted by Burst → Arrival → ID):
{ready_list}

Selected: {process_id} (Burst={burst}, Arrival={arrival})

idle.title: Step {step}: CPU Idle (t={current_time})
idle.description:
No process is ready at t={current_time}.

Waiting for next arrival...
Next process arrives at t={next_arrival}.
